snippet: Brett McGurk, a top State Department official, provided new details about the Iraqi government’s effort to regain control of a key Sunni city now occupied by jihadists.
abstract: Iraqi Army is planning to cordon off key Sunni city of Falluja, now occupied by jihadists, in order to allow Sunni tribes to lead mission to secure it one neighborhood at a time; strategy to take on militants has been developed with advice from American military officers.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DURAID ADNAN
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington, and Duraid Adnan from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: Brett McGurk, a top State Department official, provided new details about the Iraqi government’s effort to regain control of a key Sunni city now occupied by jihadists.

headline.main: Iraqi Tribes to Take Lead in Falluja Fight, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Tribes to Take Lead in Falluja Fight, U.S. Says
